{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Executive Assistant",
  "description": "Union Maritime is at the forefront of the maritime industry, offering our customers cutting-edge transportation and logistics solutions. We constantly push the boundaries of what is possible, leveraging the latest technologies and industry best practices to deliver unparalleled efficiency and reliability. Whether it&#39;s our innovative approach to cargo handling or our use of data analytics to optimise routes and logistics, we are dedicated to staying ahead of the curve. At Union Maritime, we don&#39;t just meet the needs of our customers; we anticipate them. Join us on the cutting edge of maritime innovation and experience the Union Maritime difference.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Executive Assistant

Job Location:&nbsp;Apapa, Lagos

Description
Key Responsibilities will include:


	Providing administrative support to ensure efficient office operations.
	Providing general support to clients and other visitors.
	Organizing and maintaining the executive&rsquo;s calendar, scheduling appointments, meetings and events.
	Prioritizing and managing conflicting schedules to ensure the executive&rsquo;s time is used effectively.
	Preparing agendas, briefing documents and presentations for executive meetings.
	Attending meetings, taking detailed minutes, and ensuring the action items are tracked and completed.
	Coordinating logistics for meetings, including room set up and catering, in line with Global Administration procedures.
	Coordinating travel arrangements, including flights, accommodations and ground transport.
	Organising and administer travel visas if required.
	Working closely with executive and senior administrative assistants to handle requests and queries from senior Management.
	Working with sensitive information with discretion to maintain confidentiality and security and ensure compliance with privacy policies and regulations.
	Providing polite and professional communication.
	Liaising between the executives and other departments, or stakeholders to ensure timely communications.
	Managing special projects as assigned, ensuring they are completed on time and within budget.


Requirements
Qualifications:


	5 to 7 years of experience in similar role.
	Proven administrative or assistant experience.
	Knowledge of office management systems and procedures.
	Excellent time management skills and ability to multitask and prioritize work.
	Attention to detail and problem-solving skills.
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
	Strong organizational and planning skills.
	Proficient in MS Office.
",
  "datePosted": "2025-07-24",
  "validThrough": "2025-08-25",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Union Maritime"
    
  },

    "@type": "Place",

      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },

  },

    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",

Executive Assistant Job at Union Maritime




        
    

        
        Union Maritime is at the forefront of the maritime industry, offering our customers cutting-edge transportation and logistics solutions. We constantly push the boundaries of what is possible, leveraging the latest technologies and industry best practices to deliver unparalleled efficiency and reliability. Whether it's our innovative approach to cargo handling or our use of data analytics to optimise routes and logistics, we are dedicated to staying ahead of the curve. At Union Maritime, we don't just meet the needs of our customers; we anticipate them. Join us on the cutting edge of maritime innovation and experience the Union Maritime difference.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Executive Assistant
     

            
    



Job Location: Apapa, Lagos

Description
Key Responsibilities will include:


	Providing administrative support to ensure efficient office operations.
	Providing general support to clients and other visitors.
	Organizing and maintaining the executive’s calendar, scheduling appointments, meetings and events.
	Prioritizing and managing conflicting schedules to ensure the executive’s time is used effectively.
	Preparing agendas, briefing documents and presentations for executive meetings.
	Attending meetings, taking detailed minutes, and ensuring the action items are tracked and completed.
	Coordinating logistics for meetings, including room set up and catering, in line with Global Administration procedures.
	Coordinating travel arrangements, including flights, accommodations and ground transport.
	Organising and administer travel visas if required.
	Working closely with executive and senior administrative assistants to handle requests and queries from senior Management.
	Working with sensitive information with discretion to maintain confidentiality and security and ensure compliance with privacy policies and regulations.
	Providing polite and professional communication.
	Liaising between the executives and other departments, or stakeholders to ensure timely communications.
	Managing special projects as assigned, ensuring they are completed on time and within budget.


Requirements
Qualifications:


	5 to 7 years of experience in similar role.
	Proven administrative or assistant experience.
	Knowledge of office management systems and procedures.
	Excellent time management skills and ability to multitask and prioritize work.
	Attention to detail and problem-solving skills.
	Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
	Strong organizational and planning skills.
	Proficient in MS Office.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Instrumentation and Control Engineer",
  "description": "Myrtle Management Consultants Limited -&nbsp; Our client&nbsp;is an indigenous and foremost provider of Engineering, Procurement, Construction, and Installation (EPCI) services in West Africa with over 17 years of experience. They are an ISO 9001 Certified indigenous limited liability Company.

Their core mission is to help their clients achieve the highest level of safety, quality, and value-added results at optimal cost in the execution of projects. This mission is guided by their relentless focus on deploying the most updated technologies and best-fit personnel in the execution of our projects.

They are recruiting suitably qualified candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Instrumentation and Control Engineer

Job Location:&nbsp;Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary


	They urgently require an addition to their team an experienced Ex-pat or Indigenous&nbsp;Instrumentation and Control Engineer.


Job Description


	Experience in programmable logic controllers (PLC), distributed control systems (DCS), supervisory control and data acquisition (SCADA) and advanced process control (APC), SIS, HIMA,&nbsp;
	Review of Instrumentation Drawings.
	Liaising with contractors, suppliers, clients, and relevant authorities
	Working co-ordinately with purchasers, the team of engineers, scientists, operational engineers, design engineers, and other internal personnel
	Assessing and interpreting data.
	Comprehending and ensuring that all operations are performed in compliance with the quality standards as well as safety and health regulations
	Managing to complete the project within time and cost-constrained environment
	Preparing and approving project specifications, timescales, and budgets with managers/clients
	Testing, assessing, calibrating, and modifying instruments/products
	Hardware Designing &amp; Implementation for Specialized Control Systems including DCS, SIS &amp; FGS&nbsp;
	Understanding of Major Instrumentation being Used and Clarity on the Working Principle
	Understands/Able to gather required Information from Customer Specifications (including Functional Requirement Specifications, P&amp;IDs, C&amp;Es, Drawings, Narratives, Philosophies, etc.)
	Have carried out System Testing &amp; FAT
	Have been involved in Site Works including Installations Supervision, Commissioning &amp; Startups Activities.


Qualifications


	Bachelor&rsquo;s / Master&rsquo;s Degree in Engineering or in a related field
	Minimum 10+ years of work experience in Instrumentation, Automation &amp; Controls
	Hands-on Experience in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
	Must have Effective Written/Verbal Communication.
	Related experience on Wellhead Facilities including Wellhead Control Panels, Skids, will be an advantage.


Remuneration
Competitive&nbsp;along with other benefits.

Note


	Interviews are on a rolling basis to this date.
	Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.
	Further assessments will&nbsp;be required.&nbsp;

  "datePosted": "2025-07-24",
  "validThrough": "2025-08-02",

Instrumentation and Control Engineer Job at Myrtle Management Consultants Limited




        
    

        
        Myrtle Management Consultants Limited -  Our client is an indigenous and foremost provider of Engineering, Procurement, Construction, and Installation (EPCI) services in West Africa with over 17 years of experience. They are an ISO 9001 Certified indigenous limited liability Company.

Their core mission is to help their clients achieve the highest level of safety, quality, and value-added results at optimal cost in the execution of projects. This mission is guided by their relentless focus on deploying the most updated technologies and best-fit personnel in the execution of our projects.

They are recruiting suitably qualified candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Instrumentation and Control Engineer
     

            
    



Job Location: Victoria Island, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary


	They urgently require an addition to their team an experienced Ex-pat or Indigenous Instrumentation and Control Engineer.


Job Description


	Experience in programmable logic controllers (PLC), distributed control systems (DCS), supervisory control and data acquisition (SCADA) and advanced process control (APC), SIS, HIMA, 
	Review of Instrumentation Drawings.
	Liaising with contractors, suppliers, clients, and relevant authorities
	Working co-ordinately with purchasers, the team of engineers, scientists, operational engineers, design engineers, and other internal personnel
	Assessing and interpreting data.
	Comprehending and ensuring that all operations are performed in compliance with the quality standards as well as safety and health regulations
	Managing to complete the project within time and cost-constrained environment
	Preparing and approving project specifications, timescales, and budgets with managers/clients
	Testing, assessing, calibrating, and modifying instruments/products
	Hardware Designing & Implementation for Specialized Control Systems including DCS, SIS & FGS 
	Understanding of Major Instrumentation being Used and Clarity on the Working Principle
	Understands/Able to gather required Information from Customer Specifications (including Functional Requirement Specifications, P&IDs, C&Es, Drawings, Narratives, Philosophies, etc.)
	Have carried out System Testing & FAT
	Have been involved in Site Works including Installations Supervision, Commissioning & Startups Activities.


Qualifications


	Bachelor’s / Master’s Degree in Engineering or in a related field
	Minimum 10+ years of work experience in Instrumentation, Automation & Controls
	Hands-on Experience in Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
	Must have Effective Written/Verbal Communication.
	Related experience on Wellhead Facilities including Wellhead Control Panels, Skids, will be an advantage.


Remuneration
Competitive along with other benefits.

Note


	Interviews are on a rolling basis to this date.
	Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.
	Further assessments will be required. 
    

    

        Click here to Apply

title: Job Openings at Prime Pharmacy
content:
Prime Pharmacy is a Pharmaceutical company with superstores in all of its branches. We're a one-stop shop for all your medical and groceries needs. Currently, we have three branches that are currently functional and operational 24/7. The Asokoro Garki branch is the head branch while the other branches are located in Gwarimpa and Kubwa respectively.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Supervisor

Job Location: Area 11, Garki, Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time

job Description 
     

            
    




	The role of a supervisor consists of overseeing and coordinating the activities of employees within the environs of the Supermarket.
	It involves providing clerical and administrative support and ensuring all work functions are done adequately and accurately.
	A supervisor is expected to assist in the execution of all organization operations daily and must be well educated on the policies and performance expectations from all employees of the organization.


As a supervisor you must ensure:


	Ensure all sales assistant and other staff working within your shift are available and none is late or absent, report immediately to the manager for any absence
	Ensure the sales assistants price tag, clean and arrange shelves
	That all staff within your shift is properly groomed and in a very neat dressed acceptable outfits.
	Must ensure proper use and display of staff I.D Cards on duty at all times
	Ensure POS, systems and printing machines are functional at all times
	Ensure the store and its environs are properly kept neat and tidy at all times (toilet, cobwebs, floors and sinks)
	Check for restock and reorder level and report to the manager.
	Ensure the security personnel function properly and report any form of deviation
	Must ensure vigilance in the store
	Must ensure all government agencies e.g FIRS, AMAC officials are directed to appropriate persons (Technical Officer Dapo)
	Ensure the availability of change, POS paper, printing paper and nylon and analysis slip
	Customers complain should be handled professionally and immediately or call the managers attention when it is beyond the supervisor
	Must ensure all appliances in the store are properly functioning and in good state such as lighting, ACs, CCTVs and report to the technical team of any technical issues.
	Must supervise shelves to ensure products does not run out of stock
	Must be accountable for all activities both at the supermarket and pharmacy and report to the manager where need be
	Must interface with the manager to make sure job performance of the sales executives and cashier are of highest standard and must always supervise the teller point.
	Must interface with the next shift supervisors and report any technicality that requires urgent attention
	Must ensure the bus comes for restocking at the proper time
	Should be proactive in the discharge of his responsibility
	Handle staff complain and direct complain appropriately to the quota responsible
	Perform all other duties, assignments, jobs as may be assigned from time to time by the COO, HR and Manager.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: primepharmacyjobs@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

2.) Locum

Job Location: Gwarimpa and Kubuwa - Abuja

Job Description


	Giving professional advice to the patients.
	Create and maintain good relationships with customers.
	Make professional decisions in a fast-paced environment.
	Maintain records of good customer service.
	Review and analyze all customer complaints to the appropriate authorities.
	Dispensing of drugs.
	Negotiate the best deal for pricing and customers satisfaction.
	Ensure that the products and supplies are high quality.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess a relevant qualification with 2 - 3 years of work experience.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: primepharmacyjobs@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

 

3.) Procurement Officer

Job Location: Area 11 Garki, Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	Estimate and establish cost parameters and budgets for purchases.
	Create and maintain good relationships with vendors/suppliers.
	Make professional decisions in a fast-paced environment.
	Maintain records of purchases, pricing, and other important data.
	Review and analyze all vendors/suppliers, supply, and price options.
	Develop plans for purchasing equipment, services, and supplies.
	Negotiate the best deal for pricing and supply contracts.
	Ensure that the products and supplies are high quality.
	Maintain and update a list of suppliers and their qualifications, delivery times, and potential future development.
	Work with team members and procurement manager to complete duties as needed.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: primepharmacyjobs@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

  "title": "Administrative Officer",
  "description": "Chelis Bookazine Limited is Nigeria&rsquo;s leading educational supplier, supplying top quality international educational books, resources and services to Nigeria&rsquo;s education industry. Chelis has completely revolutionized the school supply industry in Nigeria because of the passion, creativity, total commitment and dedication we bring into our business to achieve our vision of contributing significantly to the provision of top quality, world class education in Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Administrative Officer&nbsp;

Job Location:&nbsp;Asaba, Delta
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	We are in search of a meticulous Admin Officer to uphold administrative efficiency and financial integrity at our esteemed Asaba branchin Delta State.
	Your role will encompass managing administrative tasks, handling financial transactions, and ensuring regulatory compliance.


Responsibilities


	Manage general office operations, supplies, correspondence, and filing systems.
	Support basic accounting functions such as invoicing, expense tracking, and petty cash management.
	Coordinate schedules, meetings, and appointments.
	Liaise with vendors, service providers, and external partners to ensure office needs are met.
	Assist in monitoring compliance with internal policies and procedures.
	Maintain accurate and up-to-date financial and administrative records.
	Prepare reports, presentations, and documentation as required.
	Drive on official assignments when required.
	Perform other duties as assigned to support smooth office operation.


Requirements


	B.Sc / HND in Accounting, Business Administration, or a related field
	Minimum of 2 years of post NYSC work experience in administrative and accounting roles
	Proficiency in accounting software and Microsoft Office suite
	Strong attention to detail and accuracy in financial data management
	Excellent organizational and multitasking abilities
	Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment
	Driving skill with a valid driving license
	Close proximity or within reasonable commuting distance to Nnebisi stree,t Asaba Delta stateis a plus
	The position entails working two Saturdays per month.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;chelisrecruitment@gmail.com&nbsp;using &quot;Administrative Officer - Asaba&quot; as the subject of the mail.",

Administrative Officer Job at Chelis Bookazine Limited




        
    

        
        Chelis Bookazine Limited is Nigeria’s leading educational supplier, supplying top quality international educational books, resources and services to Nigeria’s education industry. Chelis has completely revolutionized the school supply industry in Nigeria because of the passion, creativity, total commitment and dedication we bring into our business to achieve our vision of contributing significantly to the provision of top quality, world class education in Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Administrative Officer 

Job Location: Asaba, Delta
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

            
    




	We are in search of a meticulous Admin Officer to uphold administrative efficiency and financial integrity at our esteemed Asaba branchin Delta State.
	Your role will encompass managing administrative tasks, handling financial transactions, and ensuring regulatory compliance.


Responsibilities


	Manage general office operations, supplies, correspondence, and filing systems.
	Support basic accounting functions such as invoicing, expense tracking, and petty cash management.
	Coordinate schedules, meetings, and appointments.
	Liaise with vendors, service providers, and external partners to ensure office needs are met.
	Assist in monitoring compliance with internal policies and procedures.
	Maintain accurate and up-to-date financial and administrative records.
	Prepare reports, presentations, and documentation as required.
	Drive on official assignments when required.
	Perform other duties as assigned to support smooth office operation.


Requirements


	B.Sc / HND in Accounting, Business Administration, or a related field
	Minimum of 2 years of post NYSC work experience in administrative and accounting roles
	Proficiency in accounting software and Microsoft Office suite
	Strong attention to detail and accuracy in financial data management
	Excellent organizational and multitasking abilities
	Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment
	Driving skill with a valid driving license
	Close proximity or within reasonable commuting distance to Nnebisi stree,t Asaba Delta stateis a plus
	The position entails working two Saturdays per month.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: chelisrecruitment@gmail.com using "Administrative Officer - Asaba" as the subject of the mail.
